channel.title: Packaging?
channel.description:
When i try to package my delta to look like a PI. I get an error saying- Package cannot be found. This is how i have it imported into the client.java.
[code]import server.src.skills;[/code]
Is this the wrong Syntax?

item.title: Packaging?
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

Make sure you have the file in the folder which matches with the package name.

To created a package use:

package org.delta.#name#.#name2#.#name3#;

When importing a package, use the import keyword, and let it import the exact name as above.

Read full topic

@Wintercanon wrote:

Packaging is for organisation. DeltaScape and Project Insanity are an eyesore of spaghetti code, there is no point in packaging them.

item.title: Packaging?
item.dc:creator: @Ags_Rush Ags Rush
item.description:
@Ags_Rush wrote:

I’m still getting the same errors. Can anyone tv it with more, or help more?

Here are the newest import statements.

[code]//Packaging by Zach

import server.events.Event;
import server.events.EventContainer;
import server.events.EventManager;
import server.clickingMost;
import server.item.GameItem;
import server.item.Item;

import server.item.Object;
import server.npc.NPC;
import server.npc.NPCAgression;
import server.npc.NPCDrops;
import server.npc.NPCHandler;
import server.npc.NPCList;
import server.Constants;
import server.Cryption;
import server.Curses;
import server.CustomCommand;

import server.MD5;

import server.special;

import server.player.Player;
import server.player.PlayerHandler;
import server.potions.potions;
import server.skills.Woodcutting;[/code]

item.title: Packaging?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

You have to import the specific package
if u want to import herblore then write

import server.src.skills.Herblore;

Also I don’t know how u come to server.src ?
